title: ${sex__title_prefix} population ${age_group__title_suffix}
subtitle: ${projection__subtitle}

title: ${sex__title_prefix} population by broad age group
subtitle: ${projection__subtitle}

title: ${sex__title_prefix} age structure
subtitle: ${projection__subtitle}

title: Annual change in ${sex__title_prefix} population ${age_group__title_suffix}
subtitle: ${projection__subtitle}

title: Population density
subtitle: The number of poeple per km² of land area.\n${projection__subtitle}

title: ${sex__title_prefix} births ${age_group__title_suffix}
subtitle: ${projection__subtitle}
_age_group: all mothers_15-19 mothers_20-24 mothers_25-29 mothers_30-34 mothers_35-39 mothers_40-44 mothers_45-49

title: Birth rate
subtitle: The number of live births occurring during the year, per 1,000 people.\n${projection__subtitle}

title: ${sex__title_prefix} deaths ${age_group__title_suffix}
subtitle: ${projection__subtitle}

title: Death rate
subtitle: The number of deaths occurring during the year, per 1,000 people.\n${projection__subtitle}

title: Number of child deaths
subtitle: The number of children who die before reaching the age of 5.\n${projection__subtitle}

title: Child mortality rate
subtitle: The share of children who die before reaching the age of 5.\n${projection__subtitle}
note: This is the probability of a child born in a specific year or period dying before reaching the age of 5, if subject to age-specific mortality rates of that period. This is given as the share of live births.

title: Number of infant deaths
subtitle: The number of children who die before reaching the age of 1.\n${projection__subtitle}

title: Infant mortality rate
subtitle: The share of children who die before reaching the age of 1.\n${projection__subtitle}
note: This is the probability of a child born in a specific year or period dying before reaching the age of 1, if subject to age-specific mortality rates of that period. This is given as the share of live births.

title: Fertility rate: children per woman
subtitle: ${projection__subtitle}
note: The total fertility rate is the number of children that would be born to a woman if she were to live to the end of her child-bearing years and give birth to children at the current age-specific fertility rates.

title: Fertility rate ${age_group__title_suffix}
subtitle: ${projection__subtitle}
note: The age-specific fertility rate measures the annual number of births to women of a specified age group per 1,000 women in that age group.
_age_group: mothers_15-19 mothers_20-24 mothers_25-29 mothers_30-34 mothers_35-39 mothers_40-44 mothers_45-49

title: Natural population growth rate
subtitle: The natural growth rate is the population increase determined by births and deaths. Migration flows are not taken into account.\n${projection__subtitle}

title: Population growth rate
subtitle: The growth rate is the population increase determined by births, deaths, and migration flows.\n${projection__subtitle}

title: ${sex__title_prefix} life expectancy at birth
subtitle: ${projection__subtitle}
note: Shown is the ‘period life expectancy’ at birth. This is the average number of years a newborn would live if age-specific mortality rates in the current year were to stay the same throughout its life.

title: ${sex__title_prefix} life expectancy ${age_group__title_suffix}
subtitle: Life expectancy for individuals who have reached age ${age_group__slug}. Estimates are expressed as the expected age at death, not as years left to live.\n${projection__subtitle}

title: Net migration
subtitle: The total number of immigrants (people moving into a given country) minus the number of emigrants (people moving out of the country).\n${projection__subtitle}

title: Net migration rate
subtitle: The total number of immigrants (people moving into a given country) minus the number of emigrants (people moving out of the country), per 1,000 people in the population.\n${projection__subtitle}

title: Sex ratio at birth
subtitle: ​​The number of male births per 100 female births. Biological birth ratios are slightly male-biased, with an expected ratio of 105 male births per 100 female births.\n${projection__subtitle}

title: Sex ratio ${age_group__title_suffix}
subtitle: The number of male individuals per 100 female individuals aged ${age_group__slug}.\n${projection__subtitle}

title: Total dependency ratio
subtitle: The age dependency ratio is the sum of the young population (under age 15) and elderly population (age 65 and over) relative to the working-age population (ages 15 to 64).\n${projection__subtitle}

title: Youth dependency ratio
subtitle: The ratio of younger dependents - people younger than 15 - to the working-age population - those aged 15 to 64.\n${projection__subtitle}

title: Old-age dependency ratio
subtitle: The ratio of the number of people older than 64 relative to the number of people in the working age population (15-64 years).\n${projection__subtitle}

title: Median age
subtitle: The median age divides the population into two parts of equal size; that is, there are as many people with ages above the median age as there are with ages below.\n${projection__subtitle}
